Our key location in one of the world's most prominent business capitals, New York City, provides you with a direct link to the latest developments, practices, and trends in these continuously evolving industries.           Ready to Proceed?        Register for Courses Now                 Noncredit Courses        Our noncredit finance, law, and accounting courses address pressing issues and are designed to meet your specific needs and level of expertise. Many courses offer continuing education credit for accountants. Whether you work in a Fortune 500 company, a high-profile law firm, or a small business, our courses provide the knowledge and the skills to keep you current. in Securities Markets     Other Resources                                     Stern Finance is widely recognized as one of the premier departments of finance in the world.                Finance Department           – Message from the Department Chair          With more than 40 full-time faculty conducting advanced research in every major aspect of the field, students have access to an unparalleled variety of courses reflecting the latest market practices and research findings.    I invite you to explore these pages to experience the range of research, courses, seminars, special events and other resources that contribute to the vibrant intellectual life of Stern’s Finance Department.    I also invite all visitors to examine our faculty’s latest publications. Guaranteed to Fail (2011) co-authored by Viral Acharya , Matthew Richardson , Stijn Van Nieuwerburgh and Lawrence White looks at Fannie Mae’s and Freddie Mac’s roles in the mortgage meltdown. Additionally, Restoring Financial Stability: Policy Recommendations from NYU Stern (2009), co-edited by Finance Professors Viral Acharya and Matthew Richardson, offers financial policy alternatives­ and specific courses of action ­to restore the global financial system. A companion volume, Regulating Wall Street (2010), co-edited by Professors Thomas Cooley, Viral Acharya , Matthew Richardson and Ingo Walter addresses the reform legislation debated by the U.S. Congress. Department / Academics / Undergraduate                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Undergraduate Program   Every type of private and public business organization needs people who have training in finance. Students graduating from the Undergraduate College with a major in finance accept prestigious positions with banks, investment banking houses, government agencies, consulting firms, insurance firms, and large and small corporations. Careers range from credit analysis to product profitability analysis to apprentice floor traders on exchanges. In addition to being well-grounded in finance, our students graduate prepared to work with multinational managers, marketing professionals, accountants, and others who depend on finance professionals to supply the analysis necessary to make profitable future decisions.    Being a part of a world-class university in the heart of New York City means that Stern students have unique opportunities not available at other universities. As part of their career preparation, all finance students are encouraged to take advantage of the many lectures and informal talks by leading business executives arranged by student clubs and the Dean’s Office.
